titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1217
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1217

encodingDesc.p: The original encoding was done in plain text files following the encoding quidelines of the Morgenländische Gesellschaft. With a dedicated web application these plain text files were transformed into XML documents validating (partially) against the Epidoc-Schema and those XML-Documents have been further sematically annotaded.
In order to avoid well known xml-issues especially in regards of overlapping elements the actual edited/annotated text was multiplied in several anonymos blocks, each block providing specific markup.

1.Kakhabīr and Yufraʿ Yar[... and Faʿ=] 2.rān have dedicated to their patron-god [Taʾlab] 3.Riyāmum, lord of Turʿat, (this) statue [as] 4.he had commanded them, [out of gratitude be-=] 5.cause he had saved his servants Kakha[bīr and …=] 6.[..] from the catastrophe that befell them [….] 7.his […]/him. And may he grant his servants Ka[khabīr] 8.and Faʿrān prosperity and well-being [and the good pleasure of] 9.their lords of the lineage of Hamdān [and their tribe] 10.of Ḥāshidum. And may he humiliate [their] foe(s) 11.[and t]heir [enemie(s)]. By Taʾlab Ri[yāmum].

Kakhabīr and Yufraʿ Yar... and Faʿ=
rān have dedicated to their patron-god Taʾlab
Riyāmum, lord of Turʿat, this statue as
he had commanded them, out of gratitude be-=
cause he had saved his servants Kakhabīr and …=
.. from the catastrophe that befell them ….
his …/him. And may he grant his servants Kakhabīr
and Faʿrān prosperity and well-being and the good pleasure of
their lords of the lineage of Hamdān and their tribe
of Ḥāshidum. And may he humiliate their foes
and their enemies . By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

of Ḥāshidum. And may he humiliate their foes
